class-name.description: Class name of the window to mirror. You can use a tool like "Spy++", "Window Detective", or similar to find the class name of a window. Class names are case-sensitive. This is useful for finding windows that have the same title, but different class names, particularly child windows of a parent window.

debug.description: A namespace where debug configurations can be specified.

enabled.description: If true, debug information will be displayed in the downscaler window.

font-size.description:
The font size to use for the debug information. A value of `1` means the pixel font has a 1:1 ratio with the screen pixels. A value of `2` means the pixel font has a 2:1 ratio with the screen pixels.

By default, the font size is chosen dynamically based on the size of the downscaler window.

show-fps.description: Whether to show the frames per second (FPS) in the debug information. The FPS represents the FPS of the downscaler window, not the source window.

show-mouse-coordinates.description: Whether to show the mouse coordinates in the debug information. This is useful for debugging that the mouse coordinates are being correctly transformed from the downscaler window to the source window.

downscale-factor.description: The factor to downscale the window by. For example, a factor of 2 will downscale the window by 2x, meaning that a window of size 1920x1080 will be downscaled to 960x540. To upscale the window, use a factor less than 1. For example, a factor of 0.5 will upscale the window by 2x, meaning that a window of size 1920x1080 will be upscaled to 3840x2160.

process-name.description: The name of a running process to search for to use as the window to downscale. This is exclusive with "window-title". Process names are case-insensitive and should always end with the ".exe" extension.

scale-height.description: The height to scale the window to. This is exclusive with "downscale-factor". If this is specified, but width is not, the width will be scaled proportionally to maintain the aspect ratio of the window.

scale-width.description: The width to scale the window to. This is exclusive with "downscale-factor". If this is specified, but height is not, the height will be scaled proportionally to maintain the aspect ratio of the window.

window-title.description: The window title to use to search for the window to downscale. This is exclusive with "process-name".

x.description: The X position of the top-left corner of the downscaler window. This will be relative to the monitor that the window is on. If this is not specified, the window will be positioned automatically.

y.description: The Y position of the top-left corner of the downscaler window. This will be relative\ to the monitor that the window is on. If this is not specified, the window will be positioned automatically.
